results.title: The Technology Revolution
results.brief_description: Shows the broad range of applications of computer technology from the office to outer space. Also raises some of the questions of the social significance of the technology revolution

results.title: Home on the range: U.S. bases in Australia
results.creator_credit: Gil Scrine and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Examines the existence of U.S. military bases in Australia and how their presence has affected its position in the nuclear arms race between the Soviet Union and America. Considers the question of nuclear arms in Australia in terms of the presence of the C.I.A. in Australia, its manipulation on the course of Australia’s political affairs and the mounting opposition by the general public. Script: Gil Scrine, Bob Connolly, David Bradbury Narrated by Annie Webster, David Ritchie

results.title: Bread and dripping
results.creator_credit: Women's Film Collective, Margot Nash and Wimins Films
results.brief_description: The role of the women during the Great Depression has often been neglected in the telling of Australian history. Using archival footage, this film illustrates the hardships and the political struggles women faced in a time of political and economic upheaval.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Women’s Film Collective, Margot Nash and Wimins Films

results.title: The Work That Was. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Who Pays the Price? (Sydney, 1979, 30 min.): Looks at the possible social effects of technological change in the context of Australia’s economic system. “Futures” (Sydney, 1979, 30 min.): Looks at the decline of labour intensive manufacturing industries in Australia, unemployment in country towns, and the prospects of the coming mineral boom.

results.title: Damn it. B.Y.O.
results.brief_description: 1. “Damn it” (Sweden, 1980, 20 min.): An animated film showing the physical and emotional stresses experienced by a young man in a big city. 2. “BYO” (Brisbane, 1980, 19 min.): A dramatisation of a school dance where smuggling alcohol causes more trouble than it’s worth.

results.title: Compilation: big brown beastie big brown face
results.brief_description: Big brown beastie, big brown face (Aust., prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman. “Ponies of Miklaengi” (U.S., prod. Daniel Smith ; dir. Gary Templeton): Two youngsters on horses round up sheep in Iceland. “So you want to own a pony” (Sydney, prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Explains the role of the Pony Club in helping owners with their first pony.

results.title: Do not pass go
results.creator_credit: Phil de Montingnie, Kent Chadwick and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the story of two young people and their confrontation with the law. Set in the streets, in the children’s courts and in the prisons, it shows that Australian welfare systems do not necessarily assist such teenagers. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil de Montingnie, Kent Chadwick and Victorian Film Corporation

results.title: Compilation: anyway what is an Australian?
results.brief_description: Anyway…what is an Australian? (Melb., dir. Barbara Boyd; exec. prod. Ross Campbell): Views the concept of multiculturalism through the eyes of several new Australians in Melbourne. “Arrivederci Roma” (Melb., dir. Geoffrey Wright; prod. Richard Zatorski): A new Australian student comes to grips with his first swimming lesson. “Minh: a Vietnamese” (Sydney): A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia.

results.title: A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Michael Creighton, Marionette Theatre of Australia and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presenter: Richard Bradshaw.

results.title: Just Part Of the Job
results.creator_credit: Evan Keddie, Kim Windsor and Victorian Unemployed Workers' Union
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion regarding sexual harassment. Shows a school leaver and her efforts to find a job. Presents the difficult situation she finds herself in when she is subject to a rather subtle form of sexual harassment in an employment interview.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Evan Keddie, Kim Windsor and Victorian Unemployed Workers’ Union
